devanagari:
मन्यसे यदि तच्छक्यं मया द्रष्टुमिति प्रभो ।
योगेश्वर ततो मे त्वं दर्शयात्मानमव्ययम् ॥ ४ ॥
transliteration:
manyase yadi tac chakyaṁ mayā draṣṭum iti prabho
yogeśvara tato me tvaṁ darśayātmānam avyayam

synonyms.meaning: O master of all mystic power

translation: If You think that I am able to behold Your cosmic form, O my Lord, O master of all mystic power, then kindly show me that universal self.
purport: It is said that one cannot see the form of the Lord with material eyes. To be able to see the universal form of the Lord, one must have divine vision. Arjuna requests the Lord, as the master of all mystic power (Yogeśvara), to grant him that vision. This verse expresses both humility and eagerness from Arjuna to understand Kṛṣṇa’s supreme form beyond the material manifestation.
